sec.p: The current population densities (2011–2018) of goshawk were 0.76 pairs/10 km 2 of total area and 3.3 pairs/10 km 2 of forested area. Between 6 and 11 (mean 8.0, SD = 1.7) breeding pairs were recorded each year. The number of breeding pairs decreased when compared with the two previous study periods ( Figure 2, Kruskall–Wallis test, H = 16.98, p < 0.0005; post hoc Mann–Whitney test, p < 0.05 for all comparisons between the three study periods). This means that, in comparison to the first study period (1982–1992), the population has decreased by almost 50%. Such a decrease in the number of breeding pairs was recorded in all forest complexes ( Table 2).
